summary: The Stop Supreme Court Leakers Act of 2025 aims to prevent unauthorized disclosure of confidential information by Supreme Court officers and employees. It defines "confidential information," including internal notes, communications, draft opinions, and justices' personal information. The bill prohibits the unauthorized disclosure of such information and establishes criminal penalties, including imprisonment and fines, for violations. It also amends existing law to allow for criminal forfeiture related to offenses under the new section.
